result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Vick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court does not object to transfer to Winnebago County.

miscConds.notes:
-Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

-Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
-Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J Vick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges or release to DRC.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEARS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  Court does not object to transfer to Winnebago County.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Defendant Timothy J Vick in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations the Second and Subsequent Offense enhancer is dismissed.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Timothy J Vick in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith via telephone.  Katie Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense attorney is ill and requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy J Vick in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time to review new discovery.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Timothy J Vick in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense is still waiting for the interrogation video. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 8/11/2015 at 1:30 pm.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Justice Point Reort received and filed. sab

Defendant Timothy J Vick in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Timothy J Vick in custody.  David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjournment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Timothy J Vick not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/11/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Timothy J Vick not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for a status date allowing time to meet with the defendant is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15  Status conference scheduled for 04-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy J Vick in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Timothy J Vick in custody.  Ron Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Timothy J Vick in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
